intro: Borya longiscapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed borya, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in nutrient-poor, acidic soils and is often found in tundra and alpine environments. Borya longiscapa plays a vital role in the ecosystems of its native habitats by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
